Description: Limestone ostracon with remains of six lines of Coptic text written in black ink on upper surface, now faded in places.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1905 / Coptic and Greek Texts of the Christian Period from Ostraka, Stelae, etc. in the British Museum (p.53, pl.40)
Hasitzka 1990 / Neue Texte und Dokumentation zum Koptisch-Unterricht (p.104)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (82649) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/82649)
Acquisition name: Purchased through: R J Moss & Co
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Brit.Mus.Copt. I 40:6 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: O.Rain.UnterrichtKopt. 156 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
